question: Question_06_(d)
statement:
What points in the plane would you plot to produce a frequency-amplitude
plot for the function in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_06_(a)}{part
(a)}?
sols:
From
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_06_(a)}{part
(a)}, we figured out that $c_{n} = -\frac{1}{2\pi in}$. We will think
that $\left | c_n \right |$ is the amplitude of ascillation with
frequency $\omega _n$ Our T is equal to 1 since it was the range of
\emph{x}.

we are plotting points that is (frequency, amplitude) with the following
information above.

frequency $=\omega _n = \frac{n}{T} =n$. amplitude
$=\left | c_n \right |= \left | -\frac{1}{2\pi in} \right |=\sqrt {\frac{-i}{2\pi n}^{2}}=\frac{1}{2\pi n}$
(For frequency when n = 0, amplitude is equal to $\left | c_0 \right |$
which is $c_{0} = \frac{1}{2}$ from
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2010/Question_06_(a)}{part
(a)})

my points to produce frequency- amplitude plot will be ($n$,
$\frac{1}{2\pi n}$) for $n\neq 0$ $(0, \frac{1}{2})$ for \emph{n=0}.
